column1: A hemolytic transfusion reaction is a serious complication that can occur after a blood transfusion.
If you receive blood that is not compatible with your blood, your body produces antibodies to destroy the donor's blood cells.
Blood that you receive in a transfusion must be compatible with your own blood.

Mild symptoms may be treated with: - Acetaminophen, a pain reliever to reduce fever and discomfort - Fluids given through a vein (intravenous) and other medicines to treat or prevent kidney failure and shock.
